title: How to Build a Cart for a Kayak or Canoe

steps.headline: Connect one 10" PVC into each side of a T junction.
steps.description: Do this twice to form the rails that the cart will rest on.

steps.headline: Slide the 8" pool noodles over the four 10" PVCs from the previous step.
On each T, connect the 4" PVCs into the bottom hole.
Connect the second set of T's into the bottom of the PVCs in the previous step.
Connect the 8-1/2" PVC between the two Ts to unite the two rails as one piece.
In the bottom of these Ts, insert the 2" PVCs.
Attach end caps to all open ended PVC pipes.
With the caps on, drill a 3/4" hole into each of the 2" pipes for the axle to fit through.
Put 1 washer, 1 lock washer and 1 nut on each side of each tire.
steps.description: Then put the wheels with the hardware on the axle.

steps.headline: Your cart is now ready to be used for transporting your kayak/canoe!

tyn: (2) Light weight tires that have an axle diameter of no more than 3/4"
(4) 5/8" Lock washer A drill with a 3/4" drill bit
text: Connect one 10" PVC into each side of a T junction. Do this twice to form the rails that the cart will rest on. Slide the 8" pool noodles over the four 10" PVCs from the previous step.  On each T, connect the 4" PVCs into the bottom hole.  Connect the second set of T's into the bottom of the PVCs in the previous step.  Connect the 8-1/2" PVC between the two Ts to unite the two rails as one piece.  In the bottom of these Ts, insert the 2" PVCs.  Attach end caps to all open ended PVC pipes.  With the caps on, drill a 3/4" hole into each of the 2" pipes for the axle to fit through. Then insert the axle. Put 1 washer, 1 lock washer and 1 nut on each side of each tire. Then put the wheels with the hardware on the axle. Your cart is now ready to be used for transporting your kayak/canoe!
sentences: Connect one 10" PVC into each side of a T junction.
Do this twice to form the rails that the cart will rest on.
Slide the 8" pool noodles over the four 10" PVCs from the previous step.
On each T, connect the 4" PVCs into the bottom hole.
Connect the second set of T's into the bottom of the PVCs in the previous step.
Connect the 8-1/2" PVC between the two Ts to unite the two rails as one piece.
In the bottom of these Ts, insert the 2" PVCs.
Attach end caps to all open ended PVC pipes.
With the caps on, drill a 3/4" hole into each of the 2" pipes for the axle to fit through.
Put 1 washer, 1 lock washer and 1 nut on each side of each tire.
Then put the wheels with the hardware on the axle.
Your cart is now ready to be used for transporting your kayak/canoe!
